page.title: 03The Mausoleum
page.content: A quarter of a mile from the chapel lies the mausoleum. It was one of the buildings of its time to be errected in 1776. It has a distinctive shape with arched catacombs and a dome top. It was built as a resting place for John Delaval, the last son of the Delavals. He was born in 1765 and in 1775 while paying his addresses to a laundry maid he unfortunately died after being kicked in a vital organ. This left the last male Delaval, Lord John Delaval who died at the breakfast table at 80 years of age. The Mausoleum was never, as the bishops fee was considered too expensive. So the Mausoleum was never used as, the niches in the vault are unoccupied and even today the vault has remained empty.
